title: Bones

properties.name: description
properties.value: Bones are the remains of the dead and are dropped by most monsters with animal or humanoid appearance. Monsters that do not drop bones include demons, imps, spirits, ghosts, spiders, and insectoids among others. Some monsters drop other specific types of bones, such as big bones, bat bones, monkey bones or dragon bones.

"Bone" redirects here. For remains in general, see Remains.
This article is about the standard monster drop. For other types, see Bones (disambiguation).
Bones

Item ID526

Bones are the remains of the dead and are dropped by most monsters with animal or humanoid appearance. Monsters that do not drop bones include demons, imps, spirits, ghosts, spiders, and insectoids among others. Some monsters drop other specific types of bones, such as big bones, bat bones, monkey bones or dragon bones.

A player burying bones.

Bones give 4.5 Prayer experience when buried. This can be increased by offering the bones in different ways:

  • 13.5 XP when casting Sinister Offering.
  • 13.5 XP when using the Sacred Bone Burner after the appropriate faith level has been achieved.
  • 15.7 XP when offered at a gilded altar with two burners lit or at the Chaos Temple.
  • 18 XP when offered at the Ectofuntus in the form of bonemeal.

Players may also use the Bones to Bananas or Bones to Peaches spells to turn normal bones to edible bananas or peaches.

25 regular bones are used in the Demon Slayer quest.

Trivia[edit | edit source]
